definition: amaranth (genus Amaranthus)/Joseph's coat (Amaranthus tricolor)/Chinese spinach (Amaranth mangostanus)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: Three-colored amaranth of iron of red Sangyou name, produce southern Asia archipelago formerly.
sentences.chinese: 紅桑又名鐵莧菜，原產南洋羣島。

sentences.english: RESULTS Several kinds of active compounds and some good activities were found in Acalypha.
sentences.chinese: 結果鐵莧菜屬植物具有多類化學成分和多種藥理作用。

sentences.english: Objective To determine the content of gallic acid in Acalypha australis L.
sentences.chinese: 目的測定鐵莧菜中沒食子酸的含量。

sentences.english: There are many wild goosefoots in the field.
Amaranth red pigment has security and practical value.
sentences.chinese: 莧菜紅指示劑具有安全性和實用價值。

sentences.english: The relationship between growth inhibition in Cu-treated Amaranthus tricolor L. seedlings and photosynthesis was studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究銅處理莧菜幼苗生長受阻與光合作用的關係。

definition: long thread moss (Nostoc flagelliforme), an edible algae/also called faat choy or hair moss
day lily (Hemerocallis), used in Chinese medicine and cuisine
citron daylily (Hemerocallis citrina Baroni)/golden needles (edible flower)
macrolepiota, mushroom native to Yunnan Province
